matchfinder 0.0.1
  • Reference

Simple wrapper to unify tolerance input

gen_tolerance_list.Rd

Simple wrapper to unify tolerance input

gen_tolerance_list(
  tolerance_vec = NULL,
  tolerance_min = NULL,
  tolerance_max = NULL
)

Arguments

tolerance_vec

Default NULL; numeric "continuous treatment" vector that we use to form non-bipartite matches: units i and j can be matched if \(\mid \texttt{tolerance_vec}[i] - \texttt{tolerance_vec}[j]\mid > \texttt{tolerance_min}\).
tolerance_min

See above for what this does - blocks matches that are too close on tolerance_vec. Something like minimum relevant difference to be a "treatment" effect. Default NULL gives zero, i.e. only blocks equality of tolerance_vec.
tolerance_max

Optionally we may want to also ensure our "treatment" values aren't too far apart. E.g. we may think our assumptions are reasonable valid for small differences in the tolerance vector, but not for large. Or another way: we're asking for say marginal effects: how bad is one extra beer a day?

Value

Either NULL, or a list with the same names as the input, with validated values.

Contents
